text.0: though een this heavens wide space and earth have spread them out nor heaven nor earth may be in greatness indras match.
text.1: awful and very mighty causing woe to men he whets his thunderbolt for sharpness as a bull.
text.2: like as the watery ocean so doth he receive the rivers spread on all sides in their ample width.
text.3: he bears him like a bull to drink of soma juice and will as warrior from of old be praised for might.
text.4: thou swayest indra all kinds of great manly power so as to bend ast were even that famed mountain down.
text.5: foremost among the gods is he through hero might set in the van the strong one for each arduous deed.
text.6: he only in the wood is praised by worshippers when he shows forth to men his own fair indrapower.
text.7: a friendly bull is he a bull to be desired when maghavan auspiciously sends forth his voice.
text.8: yet verily the warrior in his vigorous strength stirreth up with his might great battles for mankind.
text.9: and men have faith in indra the resplendent one what time he hurleth down his bolt his dart of death.
text.10: though fain for glory and with strength increased on earth he with great might destroys the dwellings made with art.
text.11: he makes the lights of heaven shine forth secure he bids exceeding wise the floods flow for his worshipper.
text.12: drinker of soma let thy heart incline to give bring thy bays hitherward o thou who hearest praise.
text.13: those charioteers of thine best skilled to draw the rein the rapid sunbeams indra lead thee not astray.
text.14: thou bearest in both hands treasure that never fails the famed one in his body holds unvanquished might.
text.15: o indra in thy members many powers abide like wells surrounded by the ministering priests.
